name: ListTeamDiscussionCommentReactions
description:
Retrieve reactions for a team discussion comment in an organization.

This tool retrieves the list of reactions for a specific comment in a team discussion within an organization on GitHub. It requires OAuth access tokens with the `read:discussion` scope. Use this when you need to analyze or display reactions to a particular discussion comment.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub organization. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team name, case-insensitive, used to identify the team in the organization.

value_schema.description: The slug of the team name.

parameters.name: discussion_number
parameters.description: The number identifying the specific discussion in the team.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies the discussion.

parameters.name: comment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique number identifying the discussion comment.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies the comment.

parameters.name: filter_by_reaction_type
parameters.description: Specify a single reaction type to filter results. Options: '+1', '-1', 'laugh', 'confused', 'heart', 'hooray', 'rocket', 'eyes'. Omit to list all reactions.

value_schema.description: Returns a single [reaction type](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/reference/reactions#reaction-types). Omit this parameter to list all reactions to a team discussion comment.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page to return (maximum 100).

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: results_page_number
parameters.description: The page number of the comments reactions to fetch from the results.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Returns a single [reaction type](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/reference/reactions#reaction-types). Omit this parameter to list all reactions to a team discussion comment.

value_schema.description: Returns a single [reaction type](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/reference/reactions#reaction-types). Omit this parameter to list all reactions to a team discussion comment.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team name.

value_schema.description: The slug of the team name.

parameters.name: discussion_number
parameters.description: The number that identifies the discussion.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies the discussion.

parameters.name: comment_number
parameters.description: The number that identifies the comment.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies the comment.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
